question: [File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Medium - Optimization Correctness] Does the variable-time optimization on lines 68-74 produce the same result as constant-time version?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Table Entry Formula] Does tables[p][i] = i * pair.1 hold for all i in [0, 2^window), or can the accumulator drift?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Scalar Reconstruction] Do the windowed bits on line 43 correctly reconstruct the original scalar when combined with doubling?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - prep_bits Contract] Does straus() rely on undocumented prep_bits() invariants that could be violated in future changes?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Medium - Pair Ownership] Does prep_tables() require ownership of pairs, or can borrowed data cause lifetime issues?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Low - Consistent Window Usage] Do straus() and straus_vartime() use the same window parameter interpretation?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Constant-Time Table Lookup] Does tables[s][index] on line 43 use constant-time array access, or can it leak index through cache?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - Doubling Count Leak] Can the number of double() operations on line 38 be observed through power analysis to leak window size?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Critical - Zero Detection] Does checking groupings[s][b] != 0 on line 68 leak scalar information through branch timing?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Medium - Accumulator Pattern] Can the sequential addition pattern on line 18 leak pair.1 through power/EM analysis?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - Identity Addition] Does res += identity have observable timing difference from res += non-identity on line 43?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Maximum Window] Can window=8 (max valid value) cause 256-element tables that are handled correctly throughout?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Medium - Single Pair] When pairs.len()==1, does straus() work correctly or should it fast-path to simple scalar multiplication?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Low - All-Zero Scalars] If all scalars are zero, does line 78 correctly return identity?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Critical - Scalar=1] When pair.0 is 1, does the table contain [identity, pair.1, 2*pair.1, ...] correctly?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - Very Large n] Can pairs with 10000+ elements cause prep_bits/prep_tables to exhaust memory?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Incorrect R Computation] If straus() computes FROST nonce commitment R incorrectly, can adversary forge signatures without knowing secret key?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Challenge Hash Manipulation] Can incorrect multiexp in challenge generation allow adversary to find second preimage enabling signature forgery?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [High - Verification Bypass] If signature verification uses straus_vartime() and it has bugs, can invalid signatures pass verification?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Group Generator Confusion] If pair.1 is not the standard generator, can table generation produce values that bypass DKG checks?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Binding Factor Error] When computing FROST binding factors in multiexp, can algorithm bugs allow adversary to forge signatures with fewer than threshold signers?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Exponential Memory Growth] Can adversary submit transactions requiring window=10 multiexp, causing 2^10=1024 element tables per validator?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Medium - CPU Exhaustion] Can adversary trigger worst-case O(n*2^window) complexity by carefully selecting n and window?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Low - Sparse Scalar DoS] Can adversary provide very sparse scalars to make vartime extremely slow due to many conditional checks?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Medium - Repeated Allocation] Can adversary cause repeated prep_tables() calls to fragment heap and slow down validator?
